title: SKPaint with more font weights such as a Thin, Light, Heavy, etc
body:
Hi again!  I am wondering if SkiaSharp can support more font weights? SKTypefaceStyle seems to only support normal, bold, italic and bolditalic.  Have I missed something?

I think this is an important capability for modern apps as we have moved past the days of 'bold' and 'not bold' being enough choice for our user interfaces.

iOS has good native support:

``` C#
public enum UIFontWeight
{
  UltraLight = 0,
  Thin = 1,
  Light = 2,
  Regular = 3,
  Medium = 4,
  Semibold = 5,
  Bold = 6,
  Heavy = 7,
  Black = 8,
}
```

Android native support is (a bit weird) via the family name:

``` C#
var Thin = Android.Graphics.Typeface.Create("sans-serif-thin", Android.Graphics.TypefaceStyle.Normal);
var Light = Android.Graphics.Typeface.Create("sans-serif-light", Android.Graphics.TypefaceStyle.Normal);
etc
```

Wpf has good native support:

``` C#
System.Windows.FontWeights.Thin;
System.Windows.FontWeights.ExtraBold;
etc
```

WinRT (UWP) also has good native support:

``` C#
Windows.UI.Text.FontWeights.Thin;
Windows.UI.Text.FontWeights.ExtraBold;
etc
```
